page.title: 05COMMENT ON AUCHTERTOOL(CONT)
page.content:
....few benefits to the village. Parents from the new estate were instrumental in having a Youth Club started but members of the Brownies,Cubs and Scouts, still have to travel to Kirkcaldy. Adults fare little better with carpet bowls, held once a week,and old time dancing in the local hotel.
With the increase in numbers of school-age children, the local primary school was saved from closure. Children over 12 years travel to Kirkcaldy for secondary education.
The villagers must travel outwith the area to find employment. A very few work in agrculture. Some work in the new petro-chemical plant at Mossmorran,two miles to the west of the village, but most work in (cont)
